Notes: As of June 1, 2020:  â Preschools and kindergartens reopened.  â All cultural events and other large public gatherings in Albania are cancelled indefinitely.  â Professional sporting events have resumed, with no spectators allowed to attend.  â Malls and shops are open with strict social distancing guidelines in place.  â Hairdressers and dentists are open with strict social distancing guidelines in place.  â Restaurants and cafes are open.  â All indoor activity centers reopened.  â Beaches are open.  â Outdoor exercise is permitted.  â Libraries and museums are open.  â Public transportation has resumed.  â All maritime and air borders have reopened.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211211025324/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/

As of June 15, 2021, gathering outdoors is permitted up to 50 individuals.  https://web.archive.org/web/20211211025324/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/

Movement Restrictions:    Is a curfew in place? Yes.  Effective September 1, 2021, public movement is restricted during the hours between 11:00pm and 6:00am, until further notice.  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? No.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211211025324/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/

Masks are mandatory for any individual 11 years old and above in all indoor and outdoor spaces to include public transportation.    Effective September 1, 2021 wearing a mask indoors is mandatory for any individual 11 years old and above,  Wearing a mask outdoors is also mandatory when social distancing is not possible as per the standard 2 meters (~6 feet) distance.  Non-compliance with this rule may result in a fine up to 3,000 ALL.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211211025324/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/

http://web.archive.org/web/20211214031917/https://shendetesia.gov.al/1234234234234523523523523431241234-2/  The Ministry of Health appeals to citizens to be vaccinated as soon as possible, to protect themselves and the health of others.  Any citizen over the age of 16 can be vaccinated at the health center or at the nearest centralized vaccination point. AntiCOVID vaccines reduce the chance of infection and greatly avoid hospitalizations and fatalities.  Vaccination is also open for children +12 years old with immune system problems, with a doctor's recommendation. Vaccination with the third dose has also started for all citizens +18 years old who have passed 6 months from the second dose.

Educational area  Meetings for training and further education purposes may only take place for people from the same household. Otherwise, training and further training may only take place for as many people as is necessary.    The schools are open to all who need them. It is mandatory to wear a mask in the entire school building, as well as in class and group rooms.    3-G rule also at universities and colleges  The so-called 3-G rule is also used at universities and colleges  . As in other areas of life, those who have been tested, recovered and vaccinated should be granted access to the campus. For this, the current legal basis, the 2nd COVID-19 University Act , will be extended to the coming winter semester 2021/22 until February 28, 2022 and adjusted accordingly.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/00qXI#selection-3229.0-3281.98 [Nationwide measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/W1r6U [FAQ on current university and college operations]

Corona traffic light map  "On November 25th, 2021, the Corona Commission classifies all of Austria and all federal states as a very high risk.   The classification for the education sector is risk level III."    Source: https://archive.vn/I1ZDL#selection-541.0-549.62 [Corona traffic light map]

*Nationwide measures*    Educational area  "Meetings for training and further education purposes may only take place for people from the same household. Otherwise, training and further training may only take place for as many people as is necessary.    "For elementary educational institutions, institutions for out-of-school childcare and child minders, there is an obligation to provide evidence of a negative PCR test twice a week. The test must not have been carried out more than 72 hours ago.     "The schools are open to everyone who needs them. It is mandatory to wear a mask in the entire school building, as well as in class and group rooms.    "For further binding regulations see  COVID-19 School Ordinance 2021/22  and  COVID-19 University Act .    "From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location. Further information can be found on the website of the  Federal Ministry of Education, Science and Research (BMBWF)"    *Corona traffic light map*  On December 2nd, 2021, the Corona Commission classifies all of Austria and all federal states as a very high risk.   The classification for the education sector is risk level III.    *Coronavirus - Current Measures*     School:  â¢	School for everyone who needs it  â¢	The timetable remains upright  â¢	A mask requirement applies to all school levels in the school building as well as in class and group rooms.  â¢	However, children are allowed to stay at home without a doctor's certificate. Schools provide care and learning packages for these children.  â¢	Details can be found on the website of the Ministry of Education    Sources:  https://archive.vn/K9UCW#selection-597.0-605.62 [Corona traffic light map]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Nationwide measures  Educational area  The rules of meetings apply to extracurricular youth education, youth work and supervised holiday camps. In addition, the following applies:  â¢	Individuals may participate with a 2.5G certificate  â¢	A maximum of four supervisors per group of 25 participants is permitted.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.    For elementary educational institutions, institutions for out-of-school childcare and child minders, there is an obligation to provide evidence of a negative PCR test twice a week. The test must not have been carried out more than 72 hours ago.     The schools are open to everyone who needs them. It is mandatory to wear a mask in the entire school building, as well as in class and group rooms. If students are in the school building and do not have 2G evidence, antigen or PCR tests must be carried out at least twice a week. However, these must be carried out so often that valid evidence must be presented for each day of the teaching week.    From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location.    **Corona traffic light map**  On December 9th, 2021 the Corona Commission classifies all of Austria and all federal states as a very high risk.     The classification for the education sector is risk level III.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/mKGBo [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/XRh8n  [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/C8xH8 [Corona traffic light map]

Educational area  For extracurricular youth education, youth work and supervised holiday camps, the rules of the get-togethers apply. In addition, the following applies:    Individuals may participate with a 2.5G certificate  A maximum of four supervisors per group of 25 participants is permitted.  If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.  For elementary educational institutions, institutions for out-of-school childcare and child minders, there is an obligation to provide evidence of a negative PCR test twice a week. The test must not have been carried out more than 72 hours ago.     The schools are open to everyone who needs them. It is mandatory to wear a mask in the entire school building, as well as in class and group rooms. If students are in the school building and do not have 2G evidence, antigen or PCR tests must be carried out at least twice a week. However, these must be carried out so often that valid evidence must be presented for each day of the teaching week.    For further binding regulations see  COVID-19 School Ordinance 2021/22  and its  amendments   as well as  COVID-19 Higher Education Act .    From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location. Further information can be found on the website of the  Federal Ministry of Education, Science and Research (BMBWF).    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20211217202434/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/

At work  â¢	The professional activity should preferably take place outside the workplace, if this is possible and both employer: in and employee: in agree.  â¢	Employees, owners and operators may only enter workplaces where physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out if they have a 3G certificate. (A maximum of two physical contacts per day, which take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes, are not considered to be contacts).  â¢	An FFP2 mask should be worn if physical contact with people cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability or an evaluation that is not timely, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they present 3G evidence. This also applies to operators.  â¢	Workplaces in the health and care sector may only be entered with 2G evidence and an additional negative PCR test. In retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled as well as in hospitals and health resorts and other places where health services are provided, wearing an FFP2 mask in closed rooms is also mandatory. (Exception: Operator: inside, employees may, as an exception, also let in with a negative antigen test from an authorized body, provided that no negative PCR test can be presented due to lack of availability or an evaluation that is not timely. This also applies accordingly to the operator: Inside).    Customer areas  â¢	Business premises of the trade, body-related services and leisure or cultural facilities are not allowed to be entered. The exception is the collection of pre-ordered goods, whereby an FFP2 mask must be worn.  â¢	Customer areas for services that are not close to the body may only be entered with 2G proof.  â¢	There are exceptions for business premises for daily needs, such as pharmacies, grocery stores, banks, petrol stations, etc.  â¢	Entering the customer area of business premises is only permitted for customers with an FFP2 mask. If the customer cannot wear an FFP2 mask due to the nature of the service, this is only permitted if the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    Leisure, sport and culture    Leisure  Leisure facilities (such as leisure and amusement parks, baths, dance schools, facilities for practicing prostitution, animal parks, etc.) are closed.    Culture and culture  Art and cultural institutions (museums, art halls, cultural exhibition halls, libraries, libraries, archives, theaters, cinemas, variety theaters, cabarets, concert halls and arenas) are closed.    Sports  â¢	Indoor sports facilities are closed (exceptions: outdoor sports facilities, top athletes, disabled sports, professional athletes and their supervisors and trainers as well as representatives of the media).  â¢	Outdoor sports facilities are open, whereby the exercise of sports may only take place with people who live in the same household, the partner who does not live in the same household, individual closest relatives such as parents, children and siblings or individual important caregivers.  â¢	Top athletes:  	o	When top athletes practice sport, the responsible doctor must develop a COVID-19 prevention concept and monitor compliance with it on an ongoing basis.  	o	Top athletes, as well as their supervisors and trainers, have to show a 3G certificate for training and competitions if physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out.  	o	If a SARS-CoV-2 infection becomes known to an athlete, supervisor or trainer, all athletes, supervisors and trainers must undergo a molecular biological test or an antigen test for the presence of a SARS-CoV- 2 to undergo infection.    Gastronomy and accommodation    Gastronomy  â¢	The catering is closed.  â¢	(Exceptions are catering establishments in hospitals and health resorts, old people's and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled, facilities for the care and accommodation of children and young people and companies for people who are exclusively cared for, accommodated or not staying there for mere visits).  â¢	There is an FFP2 mask requirement for customers. Furthermore, the consumption of food and drinks is not permitted in the immediate vicinity of the dispensing point and may only be consumed while sitting at the dispensing stations. Self-service is permitted, provided that the risk of infection can be minimized through special hygienic precautions.  â¢	With the FFP2 mask, it is permitted to collect food and non-alcoholic beverages as well as alcoholic beverages that are filled in commercially available sealed containers.    Accommodation  â¢	Accommodation establishments (including campsites and shelters) are closed.  â¢	(Exceptions, the purpose of looking after and providing assistance to people in need of support, professional reasons that cannot be postponed, satisfying an urgent need for housing, spa guests or patients and their accompanying persons in a spa or rehabilitation facility, as well as for pupils for the purpose of attending school and students Study purposes).  â¢	Persons who were already in accommodation at the time this provision came into force or for whom in advance with the accommodation provider: in the agreed period of accommodation, an exception can be made.  â¢	When entering the FFP2 mask requirement applies.    Gastronomy  â¢	The catering is closed.  â¢	(Exceptions are catering establishments in hospitals and health resorts, old people's and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled, facilities for the care and accommodation of children and young people and companies for people who are exclusively cared for, accommodated or not staying there for mere visits).  â¢	There is an FFP2 mask requirement for customers. Furthermore, the consumption of food and drinks is not permitted in the immediate vicinity of the dispensing point and may only be consumed while sitting at the dispensing stations. Self-service is permitted, provided that the risk of infection can be minimized through special hygienic precautions.  â¢	With the FFP2 mask, it is permitted to collect food and non-alcoholic beverages as well as alcoholic beverages that are filled in commercially available sealed containers.    Accommodation  â¢	Accommodation establishments (including campsites and shelters) are closed.  â¢	(Exceptions, the purpose of looking after and providing assistance to people in need of support, professional reasons that cannot be postponed, satisfying an urgent need for housing, spa guests or patients and their accompanying persons in a spa or rehabilitation facility, as well as for pupils for the purpose of attending school and students Study purposes).  â¢	Persons who were already in accommodation at the time this provision came into force or for whom in advance with the accommodation provider: in the agreed period of accommodation, an exception can be made.  â¢	When entering the FFP2 mask requirement applies. Accommodation  â¢	Accommodation establishments (including campsites and shelters) are closed.  â¢	(Exceptions, the purpose of looking after and providing assistance to people in need of support, professional reasons that cannot be postponed, satisfying an urgent need for housing, spa guests or patients and their accompanying persons in a spa or rehabilitation facility, as well as for pupils for the purpose of attending school and students Study purposes).  â¢	Persons who were already in accommodation at the time this provision came into force or for whom in advance with the accommodation provider: in the agreed period of accommodation, an exception can be made.  â¢	When entering the FFP2 mask requirement applies. Sport  â¢	Indoor sports facilities are closed (exceptions: outdoor sports facilities, top athletes, disabled sports, professional athletes and their supervisors and trainers as well as representatives of the media).  â¢	Outdoor sports facilities are open, but sports may only be practiced with people who live in the same household, the partner who does not live in the same household, individual closest relatives such as parents, children and siblings or individual important caregivers. Lingering in the sports facility is limited to the duration of the exercise.  o	Only sports without physical contact may be practiced.  o	In non-public sports facilities, only people with a 2G certificate have access.  o	Closed areas of the sports facility may only be entered if this is necessary for outdoor sports.  â¢	Top athletes:  o	When top athletes practice sports, the responsible doctor must develop a COVID-19 prevention concept and monitor compliance with it on an ongoing basis.  o	Top athletes, as well as their supervisors and trainers, have to show a 3G certificate for training and competitions if physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out.  o	If a SARS-CoV-2 infection becomes known to an athlete, supervisor or trainer, all athletes, supervisors and trainers must undergo a molecular biological test or an antigen test for the presence of a SARS-CoV- 2 to undergo infection.      *Coronavirus - Current Measures*    Place of professional activity:  â¢ General home office recommendation, federal employees also work from home    Customer areas, trade & services:  â¢ Business premises of the trade as well as body-related services, leisure facilities and cultural facilities are not allowed to be entered.  â¢ Customer areas for services that are not close to the body may only be entered upon presentation of a 2-G certificate. Customers also have to wear a mask. If this is not possible due to the nature of the service, other suitable protective measures must be taken to minimize the risk of infection.  â¢ Exceptions are permanent establishments of the universal service. Only goods may be offered that correspond to the typical range of goods at the business premises. Here customers have to wear an FFP 2 mask, for example :  	o	public pharmacies  	o	Grocery retailers and farm direct marketers  	o	Drug stores and drug stores  	o	Banks  	o	Gas stations  â¢ The opening times of the retail outlets that sell goods are limited to 7 p.m.    Gastronomy:  â¢ Gastronomy facilities may only be entered for the collection of food and alcohol-free alcoholic beverages that are filled in commercially closed containers. A mask must be worn here. Consumption is not permitted within a 50 m radius .  â¢ Take away from restaurants is still possible all day.  â¢ Advent and Christmas markets are currently not allowed to take place. (A maximum of two physical contacts per day, which take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes, are not considered to be contacts).  â¢	An FFP2 mask should be worn if physical contact with people cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.    Customer areas  â¢	 Retail establishments as well as (close to the body) services may only be entered with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	Exceptions to the 2-G obligation are basic supply facilities, such as: public pharmacies, grocery stores and rural direct marketers, drug stores and drugstores, banks, petrol stations  â¢	The FFP2 mask requirement applies in closed rooms when entering and driving the customer area of business premises as well as the connecting structures of structurally connected business premises (e.g. shopping centers, market halls).  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	The opening times of business premises are only permitted between 5:00 a.m. and 11:00 p.m    Gastronomy and accommodation    Gastronomy  â¢	The catering is open to customers with a valid 2G certificate.  â¢	Each customer must be assigned a seat and the business premises must only be entered between 5 a.m. and 11 p.m.  â¢	The consumption of food and drinks must not take place in the immediate vicinity of the dispensing point and only while sitting at the dispensing stations. In the open air, food and drink stands may also be consumed while standing at administration points.  â¢	The FFP2 mask requirement applies in closed rooms, but not while staying at the administration area.  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	Exceptions are operating modes of the hospitality industry in hospitals and health resorts, retirement and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled, facilities for the care and accommodation of children and young people, including schools and elementary educational facilities and companies, if these are used exclusively by employees or people who work there .  â¢	Self-service is permitted, provided that the risk of infection can be minimized through special hygienic precautions.  â¢	The collection of food and alcohol-free and alcoholic beverages filled in commercially available sealed containers is permitted for all persons with an FFP2 mask, regardless of the 2G proof.    accommodation  â¢	Accommodation establishments (including campsites and shelters) may only be entered with a 2G certificate.  â¢	When entering the FFP2 mask requirement applies.  â¢	An exception to the 2G verification requirement can be made for the absolutely necessary duration if 3G verification is provided and if:  o	Persons who were already in accommodation at the time this provision came into force, for in advance with the accommodation provider: in the agreed period of accommodation,  o	for the purpose of looking after and providing assistance to people in need of support, professional reasons that cannot be postponed, satisfying an urgent need for housing, spa guests or patients and their accompanying persons in a spa or rehabilitation facility.  â¢	Exceptions apply to schoolchildren for the purpose of attending school and students for study purposes.  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    **Coronavirus - Current Measures**    Place of professional activity  â¢	â¢The 3-G obligation continues to apply at the place of work.  â¢	â¢An FFP2 mask is compulsory in all closed rooms, unless other suitable protective devices are in place.  â¢	â¢A home office arrangement is generally recommended.    Gastronomy  Generally:  â¢	â¢General ban on night gastronomy including aprÃ¨s-ski  â¢	â¢General ban on standing gastronomy  â¢	â¢General ban on bar operations  â¢	â¢Unvaccinated people can also pick up food and drinks. An FFP2 mask is mandatory.  Indoor:  â¢	â¢Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	â¢There is an FFP2 mask requirement, except at the seat.  â¢	â¢Operators have to collect contact details.  â¢	â¢Operators have to appoint a: n COVID-19 officer: n and create a COVID-19 prevention concept.  Outdoor:  â¢	â¢Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	â¢Operators have to collect contact details.  â¢	â¢Operators have to appoint a: n COVID-19 officer: n and create a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Occasional markets  Pure sales market (only sales of goods, food, beverages - no consumption):  â¢	â¢Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	â¢There is an FFP2 mask requirement in closed rooms.  â¢	â¢Operators have to appoint a: n COVID-19 officer: n and create a COVID-19 prevention concept.  "Kirtags-like" occasional markets (with services and consumption, e.g. Christmas markets etc.):  â¢	â¢Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	â¢There is an FFP2 mask requirement in closed rooms.  â¢	â¢Obligation to notify from 50 people  â¢	â¢Authorization required from 250 people  â¢	â¢Maximum limit: max. 300 people  â¢	â¢Contact data collection  â¢	â¢Operators have to appoint a: n COVID-19 officer: n and create a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Accommodation establishments  â¢	â¢Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	â¢There is an FFP2 mask requirement in all accessible areas.  â¢	â¢Operators have to collect contact details.  â¢	â¢Operators have to appoint a: n COVID-19 officer: n and create a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Sports facilities  â¢	â¢Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof  â¢	â¢There is an FFP2 mask requirement in generally accessible closed areas. There is no need to wear a mask during exercise.  â¢	â¢Operators have to collect contact details.  â¢	â¢Operators have to appoint a: n COVID-19 officer: n.  â¢	â¢Operators of non-public sports facilities also have to create a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	â¢In the case of training, competitions and championship games, the regulations for meetings also apply .    Sources:  https://archive.vn/mKGBo [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/XRh8n  [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

**Nationwide measures**  At work  â¢	The professional activity should preferably take place outside the workplace, if this is possible and both employer: in and employee: in agree.  â¢	Employees, owners and operators may only enter workplaces where physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out if they have a 3G certificate. (A maximum of two physical contacts per day, which take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes, are not considered to be contacts).  â¢	An FFP2 mask should be worn if physical contact with people cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.      Leisure, sport and culture  leisure  Access to leisure facilities (such as leisure and amusement parks, baths, dance schools, facilities for practicing prostitution, animal parks, etc.) is only permitted for people with a 2G certificate.  â¢	The FFP2 mask requirement applies in closed rooms  â¢	The opening times are only permitted between 5:00 a.m. and 11:00 p.m.  â¢	Operators of leisure facilities must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  Culture and culture  Access to art and cultural institutions (museums, art halls, cultural exhibition halls, libraries, libraries, archives, theaters, cinemas, variety theaters, cabarets, concert halls and arenas) is only permitted with 2G proof.  â¢	The FFP2 mask requirement applies in closed rooms  â¢	The opening times are only permitted between 5:00 a.m. and 11:00 p.m.  â¢	Operators of leisure facilities must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  Sports  â¢	Entering sports facilities for the purpose of doing sports is only permitted under certain conditions:  o	A 2G certificate applies to non-public sports facilities as well as an FFP2 mask requirement in closed rooms.  o	 The opening times of sports facilities are only permitted between 5 a.m. and 11 p.m.  â¢	Outdoor sports facilities are open to everyone regardless of the 2G certificate, whereby sports may only be practiced with people who live in the same household, the partner who does not live in the same household, individual closest relatives such as parents, children and siblings or individual important reference persons. Lingering in the sports facility is limited to the duration of the exercise.  â¢	Only sports without physical contact may be practiced.  â¢	In non-public sports facilities, only people with a 2G certificate have access.  â¢	Closed areas of the sports facility may only be entered if this is necessary for outdoor sports.  â¢	The operator of non-public sports facilities must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	Top athletes:  o	When top athletes practice sport, the responsible doctor must develop a COVID-19 prevention concept and monitor compliance with it on an ongoing basis.  o	Top athletes, as well as their supervisors and trainers, have to show a 3G certificate for training and competitions if physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  o	If a SARS-CoV-2 infection becomes known to an athlete, supervisor or trainer, all athletes, supervisors and trainers must undergo a molecular biological test or an antigen test for the presence of a SARS-CoV- 2 to undergo infection. area.  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	Exceptions are operating modes of the hospitality industry in hospitals and health resorts, retirement and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled, facilities for the care and accommodation of children and young people including schools and elementary educational facilities and companies, if these are used exclusively by employees or people who work there .  â¢	Self-service is permitted, provided that the risk of infection can be minimized through special hygienic precautions.  â¢	The collection of food and alcohol-free and alcoholic beverages filled in commercially available sealed containers is permitted for all persons with an FFP2 mask, regardless of the 2G proof.  accommodation  â¢	Accommodation establishments (including campsites and shelters) may only be entered with a 2G certificate.  â¢	When entering the Stay at home requirements, closing of event facilities (entertainment, amusement or recreation) as part of the 5th COVID-19 Emergency Measures Ordinance are in place, in effect covering all events.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/lFJFe [5th COVID-19 Emergency Measures Ordinance]  https://archive.vn/00qXI [Nationwide measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

All-day exit restrictions apply - essentially preventing public events.  Exceptions are in place (for example demonstrations "Assemblies according to the assembly law")    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Meetings  Generally:  â¢	Organizers have to collect contact details.  â¢	Organizers have to appoint a: n COVID-19 officer: n and draw up a COVID-19 prevention concept.  Indoor without assigned seats:  â¢	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	An FFP2 mask is required.  â¢	Maximum limit: max. 25 people (including family reunions, birthday parties, wedding parties, Christmas parties, etc.)  Indoor with assigned seats:  â¢	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	There is an FFP2 mask requirement, also at the seat.  â¢	Obligation to notify from 50 people  â¢	Authorization required from 250 people  â¢	Maximum limit: max. 2,000 people  Outdoor with no assigned seating:  â¢	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	Obligation to notify from 50 people  â¢	Authorization required from 250 people  â¢	Maximum limit: max. 300 people  Outdoor with assigned seating:  â¢	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	Obligation to notify from 50 people  â¢	Authorization required from 250 people  â¢	Maximum limit: max. 4,000 people    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20211217201842/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html

'Leaving your own private living space for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings' - so in effect gatherings are restricted to those in the private living space for most citizens.    Meetings  â¢	Leaving your own private living space for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings:  o	Funerals  o	Assemblies according to the assembly law  o	Meetings for professional purposes, if these are necessary to maintain the professional activity  o	meetings of organs of political persons cannot be postponed if they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings of bodies of legal persons that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings that cannot be postponed under the Labor Constitution Act  o	Meetings for absolutely necessary vocational training and further education purposes, to fulfill the necessary integration measures according to the Integration Act and for final professional examinations, if it is not possible to hold them in digital form  o	Meetings of medical and psychosocial self-help groups  If not all participants have a 2G certificate at these gatherings, an FFP2 mask must be worn.  â¢	The following applies to meetings for rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition:  o	 the 3G rule, when physical contact with other people cannot be excluded.  o	In addition, the person responsible for the meeting must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	For meetings within the framework of the labor market service, as well as for other meetings for absolutely necessary vocational training and further education purposes, the 3G certificate applies if physical contact cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	Other exceptions for meetings:  o	Elite sport.  o	Driving into theaters, concert halls and arenas, cinemas, variety theaters and cabarets, if this is done with multi-lane vehicles.  o	rehearsals and artistic performances in a fixed composition without an audience, which are carried out for professional purposes.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/lFJFe [5th COVID-19 Emergency Measures Ordinance]  https://archive.vn/00qXI [Nationwide measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

In general, gatherings are kept to those within the household as exit restrictions are in place.  However there are exceptions:    Meetings  â¢	Leaving your own private living space for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings:  o	Funerals  o	Assemblies according to the assembly law  o	Meetings for professional purposes, if these are necessary to maintain the professional activity  o	meetings of organs of political persons cannot be postponed if they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings of bodies of legal persons that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings that cannot be postponed under the Labor Constitution Act  o	Meetings for absolutely necessary vocational training and further education purposes, for the fulfillment of necessary integration measures according to the Integration Act and for final professional examinations, if it is not possible to hold them in digital form  o	Meetings of medical and psychosocial self-help groups  â¢	Personal assistance and 24-hour care are not included in the maximum number of people or households.  If not all participants have a 2G certificate at these gatherings, an FFP2 mask must be worn.  â¢	The following applies to meetings for rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition:  o	 the 3G rule, when physical contact with other people cannot be excluded.  o	In addition, the person responsible for the meeting must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	For meetings within the framework of the labor market service, as well as for other meetings for absolutely necessary vocational training and further education purposes, the 3G certificate applies if physical contact cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	Other exceptions for meetings:  o	Elite sport.  o	Driving in theaters, concert halls and arenas, cinemas, variety theaters and cabarets, if this is done with multi-lane vehicles.  o	rehearsals and artistic performances in a fixed composition without an audience, which are carried out for professional purposes.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Meetings  â¢	Leaving one's own private living area for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings without 2G proof:  o	Funerals,  o	Assemblies according to the assembly law,  o	Meetings for professional purposes, if these are necessary to maintain the professional activity,  o	meetings of organs of political persons that cannot be postponed if they cannot be held in digital form,  o	meetings of bodies of legal persons that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form,  o	meetings that cannot be postponed under the Labor Constitution Act,  o	Meetings of medical and psychosocial self-help groups,  o	driving into theaters, concert halls and arenas, cinemas, variety theaters and cabarets, if this is done with multi-lane vehicles,  o	picking up food and drinks (see paragraph on gastronomy),  o	Meetings in top sport and  o	Meetings for extracurricular youth work.  â¢	Personal assistance and 24-hour care are not included in the maximum number of people or households.  â¢	A mask must be worn in closed rooms. This also applies to meetings outdoors.  â¢	Meetings can only take place between 5:00 am and 11:00 pm.  â¢	For meetings of more than 50 people, the organizers must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	For meetings in closed rooms and  without  assigned seats:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Maximum limit: max. 25 people (including family reunions, birthday parties, wedding parties, Christmas parties, etc.  â¢	For meetings in closed rooms and  with  assigned seats:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Obligation to notify from 50 people  o	Authorization required from 250 people  o	Maximum limit: max. 2,000 people  â¢	Outdoor gatherings:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Obligation to notify from 50 people  o	Authorization required from 250 people  o	Maximum limit: a maximum of 300 people without assigned seats and a maximum of 4,000 people with assigned seats  â¢	This also applies to specialist and public fairs as well as to occasional markets (e.g. Advent markets). In the case of occasional markets that offer goods, food or drinks for sale, a 2G verification requirement and an FFP2 mask requirement apply in closed rooms.  â¢	If there are more than 50 participants, the 2G rule and the recording of contact data do not apply to gatherings of a maximum of four people from fewer than three households plus six underage children of these people and minors for whom these people perform existing supervisory duties.  â¢	For meetings for rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition, the following also applies:  o	In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.   o	If a mask cannot be worn due to the activity, other suitable protective measures must be taken to minimize the risk of infection.  â¢	For meetings within the framework of the Public Employment Service (initial and advanced training, retraining and retraining as well as reintegration into the labor market, final professional exams), the 3G certificate applies if physical contact cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures and wearing an FFP2 mask. If it is not possible to wear a mask due to the nature of the training or the integration measure of people, the risk of infection must be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/mKGBo [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/XRh8n  [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Meetings  â¢	Leaving one's own private living area for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings without 2G proof:  o	Funerals,  o	Assemblies according to the assembly law,  o	Meetings for professional purposes, if these are necessary to maintain the professional activity,  o	meetings of organs of political persons that cannot be postponed if they cannot be held in digital form,  o	meetings of bodies of legal persons that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form,  o	meetings that cannot be postponed under the Labor Constitution Act,  o	Meetings of medical and psychosocial self-help groups,  o	driving into theaters, concert halls and arenas, cinemas, variety theaters and cabarets, if this is done with multi-lane vehicles,  o	picking up food and drinks (see paragraph on gastronomy),  o	Meetings in top sport and  o	Meetings for extracurricular youth work.  â¢	Personal assistance and 24-hour care are not included in the maximum number of people or households.  â¢	A mask must be worn in closed rooms. This also applies to meetings outdoors.  â¢	Meetings are only allowed between 5:00 am and 11:00 pm.  â¢	For meetings of more than 50 people, the organizers must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept. This does not apply to meetings in private living quarters.  â¢	For meetings in closed rooms and  without  assigned seats:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Maximum limit: max. 25 people (including family get-togethers, birthday parties, wedding parties, Christmas parties, etc.  â¢	For meetings in closed rooms and  with  assigned seats:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Obligation to notify from 50 people  o	Authorization required from 250 people  o	Maximum limit: max. 2,000 people  â¢	Outdoor gatherings:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Obligation to notify from 50 people  o	Authorization required from 250 people  o	Maximum limit: a maximum of 300 people without assigned seats and a maximum of 4,000 people with assigned seats  â¢	This also applies to specialist and public fairs as well as to occasional markets (e.g. Advent markets). In the case of occasional markets that offer goods, food or drinks for sale, a 2G verification requirement and an FFP2 mask requirement apply in closed rooms.  â¢	If there are more than 50 participants, the 2G rule and the recording of contact data do not apply to gatherings of a maximum of four people from fewer than three households plus six underage children of these people and minors for whom these people perform existing supervisory duties.  â¢	For meetings for rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition, the following also applies:  o	In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.   o	If a mask cannot be worn due to the activity, the risk of infection must be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	For meetings within the framework of the labor market service (training and further education, etc.), FFP2 mask requirements as well as 3G proof apply if physical contact cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures. If it is not possible to wear a mask due to the nature of the training or the integration measures of people, the risk of infection must be minimized by means of suitable protective measures.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20211217202434/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/

Public transport  An FFP2 mask must be worn in closed rooms when using cable cars and cog railways, mass transportation and the associated stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports as well as their respective connecting structures.    The following applies to the use of cable cars and cogwheel railways:  â¢	The operator may only let people in if they can show proof of 2G. The person must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.  â¢	People who use the cable car or cog railway to cover the basic needs of daily life do not have to provide proof of 2G, but wear an FFP2 mask.  â¢	The operator of cable cars and cog railways has to appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    The use of coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic is prohibited. [NB Seems to cover tourism rather than general public transport]    Sources:  https://archive.vn/lFJFe [5th COVID-19 Emergency Measures Ordinance]  https://archive.vn/00qXI [Nationwide measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Public transport  An FFP2 mask must be worn in closed rooms when using motor vehicles, taxis and taxi-like companies, school transports, cable cars and cogwheel railways, mass transportation and in the associated stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports as well as their respective connecting structures.  The following applies to the use of cable cars and cogwheel railways:  â¢	The operator may only let people in if they can show proof of 2G. The person must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.  â¢	People who use the cable car or cog railway to cover the basic needs of daily life do not have to provide proof of 2G, but wear an FFP2 mask.  â¢	The operator of cable cars and cog railways has to appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  The use of coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic requires 2G proof and an FFP2 mask requirement. The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20211217202434/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/

Exit regulation  All-day exit restrictions apply. Leaving your own private living area and staying outside your own private living area is only permitted for the following purposes:  â¢	Avoidance of immediate danger to life, limb and property.  â¢	Care of and assistance for people in need of support as well as exercise of family rights and fulfillment of family duties.  â¢	Covering the necessary basic needs of daily life, such as contact with the partner who does not live in the same household, individual close relatives (parents, children and siblings) and important reference persons, the supply of basic goods of daily life, the use of health services, the coverage a need for housing, the satisfaction of basic religious needs, as well as the care of animals.  â¢	professional and educational purposes.  â¢	Staying outdoors alone, with people from the common household or people for physical and mental relaxation.  â¢	to pursue administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed.  â¢	to participate in elections provided by law and to use the instruments of direct democracy provided by law.  â¢	for the purpose of entering customer areas of certain business premises such as pharmacies, grocery stores, drugstores, health and care services, petrol stations, banks, postal service providers, car and bicycle workshops, picking up pre-ordered meals, etc.).    Sources:  https://archive.vn/lFJFe [5th COVID-19 Emergency Measures Ordinance]  https://archive.vn/00qXI [Nationwide measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

"Exit restrictions:  â¢  All day exit restrictions  â¢  Exceptional reasons for leaving your own private living area are:      â Avoidance of an immediate danger to life, limb and property      â Care and help for people in need of support as well as the exercise of family rights and the fulfillment of family duties      â Covering the basic needs of daily life:           â¢ Necessary errands of daily life,           â¢ Contact with individual close relatives, important caregivers or the partner who does not live in the household           â¢ Health care including the way to the corona vaccination and testing for  SARS-CoV-2           â¢ Covering basic religious needs           â¢ Animal care & veterinary visits      â Professional and educational purposes, if necessary      â Stay outdoors for physical and mental relaxation      â Perception of administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed      â Participation in elections provided by law      â Entering certain customer areas      â To attend certain meetings, such as , inter alia, funerals and demonstrations."    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Nationwide measures    Exit regulation  There are no all-day exit restrictions for people with a 2G certificate, only a curfew from 11 p.m. for restaurants. Children under the age of 12 are exempt from the exit restrictions.    All-day exit restrictions apply to people without 2G proof. Leaving one's own private living area (including residential units in accommodation establishments, retirement and nursing homes, stationary residential facilities for the disabled) and staying outside one's own private living area is only permitted for the following purposes:  â¢	Avoidance of an immediate danger to life, limb and property.  â¢	Care of and assistance for people in need of support as well as exercise of family rights and fulfillment of family duties.  â¢	Covering the necessary basic needs of daily life, such as in particular  o	the contact with the partner who does not live in the same household, individual close relatives (parents, children and siblings) and important reference persons, whereby a household may only meet one other person from a second household,  o	the supply of basic goods of daily life,  o	the use of health services,  o	the coverage of a housing requirement,  o	the satisfaction of basic religious needs,  o	as well as the care of animals.  â¢	professional and educational purposes.  â¢	Staying outdoors alone, with people from the common household or people for physical and mental relaxation.  â¢	to pursue administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed.  â¢	to participate in elections provided by law and to use the instruments of direct democracy provided by law.  â¢	for the purpose of entering customer areas of certain business premises, such as pharmacies, grocery stores, drugstores, health and care services, petrol stations, banks, postal service providers, car and bicycle workshops, picking up pre-ordered meals, etc.).  â¢	Participation in certain gatherings, e.g. extracurricular youth education, top-class sport, etc.    **Coronavirus - Current Measures**    Exit restrictions  Persons without a valid 2-G certificate:  â¢	â¢All day exit restrictions  â¢	â¢Exceptional reasons for leaving your own private living area are:  o	âAvoidance of an immediate danger to life, limb and property  o	âCare and help for people in need of support as well as the exercise of family rights and the fulfillment of family duties  o	âCovering the basic needs of daily life:  ?	â¢necessary errands of daily life,  ?	â¢Contact with individual close relatives, important caregivers or the partner who does not live in the household  ?	â¢Health care including the way to the corona vaccination and testing for SARS-CoV-2  ?	â¢Covering basic religious needs  ?	â¢Animal care & veterinary visits  o	âProfessional and educational purposes, if necessary  o	âStay outdoors for physical and mental relaxation  o	âPerception of administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed  o	âParticipation in elections provided by law  o	âEntering certain customer areas  o	âTo attend certain gatherings, such as funerals or demonstrations    People with a valid 2-G certificate  There is a curfew from 11 p.m. for gastronomy.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/mKGBo [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/XRh8n  [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Entry from states and areas with a low epidemiological risk (Annex 1) with a 2.5 G certificate.  Entry from virus variant areas and states (Appendix 2) "States and areas with a high incidence of virus variants are listed in Appendix 2 . In general, you are banned from entering Austria with only a few exceptions.  No states or areas are currently listed on Appendix 2."    Regulations for entering Austria  The 7th amendment of the COVID-19 Entry Ordinance 2021 comes into force on November 22nd . It brings the following innovations for entry into Austria:  â¢	When entering the country, a 2.5 G certificate is generally required,  â¢	Antigen and antibody tests lose their validity as evidence. Exceptions are:    o	Commuters: inside (work, school / study, family purposes, life partner: in): You need a 3-G certificate .  o	People who are subject to compulsory schooling: The ninja pass is valid as proof of a low epidemiological risk. This applies in the week in which the test intervals are adhered to, also on the Friday, Saturday and Sunday of this week and (if testing is ensured immediately after entry) on the Monday of the following week  â¢	The previously privileged duration of PCR tests of 7 days for commuters will be shortened to a validity of 72 hours. Antigen tests are only valid for 24 hours.  â¢	Vaccination certificate:  o	The minimum interval between vaccinations against the coronavirus must be 14 days.  o	The period of validity of the vaccination certificate will be shortened. The proof is only valid for 9 months, with a transition period until December 6th.    Sources:   https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html  https://archive.vn/sM8jr [FAQ : Entry into Austria]  https://archive.vn/VdXdq [quarantine requirement specifics]  https://archive.vn/Hu6NG [Entry Regulations for Austria - Austria.info]

Regulations for entering Austria  The 8th amendment to the COVID-19 Entry Ordinance 2021 comes into force on November 27th . Due to the new virus variant Omicron, there is a tightening of the entry into Austria:  â¢	Classification of the following countries as virus variant areas ("Appendix 2 of the Entry Regulation "):  Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia, Zimbabwe, South Africa  â¢	Entry from these countries is generally prohibited  â¢	Essentially, only Austrian citizens and people with a place of residence or habitual abode in Austria are allowed to enter the country. Entry for humanitarian reasons or in the urgent interest of the republic is also possible. There are also a few other exceptions.  â¢	The following rules apply to these people upon entry:  o	Registration for pre-travel clearance at https://entry.ptc.gv.at/  o	Presentation of a negative molecular biological test result ( PCR test); the sampling must not be more than 72 hours ago  o	Immediate start of a ten-day quarantine. The quarantine is deemed to have ended if a further PCR test is carried out at the earliest on the fifth day after entry , the result of which is negative. The day of entry is to be regarded as "day zero".  â¢	 In addition, flights from these seven African countries will be banned from landing.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/QppwY [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211129210334/https://www.ris.bka.gv.at/Dokumente/BgblAuth/BGBLA_2021_II_492/BGBLA_2021_II_492.html [492. Ordinance of the Federal Minister for Social Affairs, Health, Care and Consumer Protection on the landing ban of aircraft from SARS-CoV-2 virus variant areas and states]

Clearance and mouth and nose protection  When entering public places in closed rooms, an FFP2 mask or a mask with at least an equivalent standardized standard must be worn.   Children up to the age of 6 do not have to wear an FFP2 mask or an MNS. Children from the age of 6 up to the age of 14 may also wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device. Pregnant women are also allowed to wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device.  A distance of 2 meters should be kept to people outside the household.    *Upper Austria. COVID-19 Measures Accompanying Ordinance 2021*  For the federal state of Upper Austria, the following additional, stricter measures will apply from November 15 (until December 5):  Expansion of the FFP2 mask requirement  â¢	In coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic.  â¢	Customers in establishments of the hospitality industry if they are not at the administration point.  â¢	Guests of accommodation establishments in generally accessible areas.  â¢	Places of occupational activity, provided that physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out and the risk of infection cannot be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	Markets and occasional markets, also outdoors.  means of transport  â¢	FFP2 mask requirement and 2G proof for coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic.  Hospitality  â¢	FFP2 mask requirement for customers from the first time they enter until they are seated at the administration point. When leaving the administration area, there is a one-meter distance to other people and an FFP2 mask is mandatory.  â¢	Consumption of food and drinks only while seated at the dispensing point and not in the immediate vicinity of the dispensing point.  â¢	Administration areas are to be set up in such a way that there is a distance of at least one meter between the groups of visitors. This does not apply if the risk of infection can be minimized through suitable protective measures for spatial separation.  â¢	The 2G rule applies to the consumption of food and drinks at snack bars and catering stands.  â¢	The night catering is closed.  Accommodation establishments  â¢	FFP2 mask requirement in generally accessible areas for guests.  Meetings  â¢	Meetings are prohibited (with the exception of: club activities, facilities for adult education and sports, funerals, assemblies, extracurricular youth education, meetings in the context of events of top-class or professional sport, provided that structural and organizational measures in the sports facility are ensured).  Trade and public fairs; Leisure and cultural facilities  â¢	Trade and public fairs are prohibited.  â¢	2G proof for customers in all cultural institutions.  â¢	Meetings in event venues only if they are held all year round and regularly.  Places of professional activity  â¢	FFP2 mask requirement if physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out and the risk of infection cannot be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	2.5G proof for employees, owners and operators in restaurants, hotels and leisure and cultural facilities (comes into force on December 5, 2021) .   Markets and Occasional Markets  â¢	FFP2 mask compulsory for all persons on the entire site.  â¢	It is forbidden to consume food and beverages anywhere on the site.    *Burgenland COVID-19 Measures Accompanying Ordinance 2021*  From November 17, 2021, an additional FFP2 mask is mandatory:  â¢	in coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic.  â¢	for customers while using body-friendly services.  â¢	For customers: inside all types of establishments in the hospitality industry (the mask may be removed while sitting at the administration point. The mask may only be removed while standing for the purpose of consuming food and beverages).  â¢	for guests in generally accessible areas in accommodation establishments (in particular lobby, reception, corridors, elevators, staircases).  â¢	for customers of leisure and cultural institutions. This does not apply in wet areas and for activities that correspond to the purpose of the facility and are associated with physical exertion.  â¢	for participants in trade and public fairs in closed rooms. In addition, food and drinks may only be consumed at the administration point.    *Measures for the entire federal state of Lower Austria*  NÃ COVID-19 Measures Accompanying Ordinance 2021  From November 17, 2021 (until December 15, 2021) an additional FFP2 mask is required:  â¢	In the hospitality industry, with the exception of lingering at the administration point. This does not apply to the administration and consumption of food and drinks outdoors.  â¢	In the interiors of cultural institutions, in particular theaters, cinemas, variety theaters, cabarets, concert halls and arenas.      Sources  : https://archive.vn/00qXI#selection-1477.0-1551.70 [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/pQOtk [Upper Austria]  https://archive.vn/t9WjJ  [Burgenland]  https://archive.vn/UYpxp [Lower Austria]

Children up to the age of 6 do not have to wear an FFP2 mask or an MNS. Children from the age of 6 up to the age of 14 may also wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device. Pregnant women are also allowed to wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device.    A distance of 2 meters should be kept to people outside the household.    An FFP2 mask must be worn in closed rooms when using cable cars and cog railways, mass transportation and the associated stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports as well as their respective connecting structures.    Entering the customer area of ??business premises is only permitted for customers with an FFP2 mask. If, due to the nature of the service, the customer cannot wear an FFP2 mask, this is only permitted if the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures. Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Coronavirus - Current Measures    Mask requirement  An FFP2 mask is compulsory in all closed rooms. This also applies at the workplace (unless other suitable protective devices are available).    Distance obligation  There is no prescribed minimum distance to people from another household. However, it is recommended that people outside the household be kept at a distance of 2 meters. Retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled    It is forbidden to enter retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled.  â¢	Exceptions:  o	Residents  o	People who are required to care for the residents or to operate the facility,  o	Visits as part of palliative and hospice support, pastoral care and support in critical life events,  o	Visits with a maximum of two people per resident per day,  o	In addition, a maximum of two people per resident in need of support per day, if they perform regular support and care tasks,  o	an additional maximum of two people per day to accompany underage residents of inpatient residential facilities for the disabled  o	external service providers, legally defined representatives, bodies of care supervision or members of established commissions.   â¢	Residents should wear an FFP2 mask in places that are generally accessible and not part of the living area.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.  â¢	The  planned measures must not be disproportionate or lead to unreasonable hardship.    The following applies to visitors:  â¢	The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they can show proof of 2G and also have a negative PCR test that was not accepted more than 72 hours ago. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	The visitor or the accompanying person must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.  â¢	The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they wear an FFP2 mask at all times during the visit or stay.    The following applies to employees:   â¢	The operator is only allowed to let employees in if they show proof of 2G. Alternatively, a valid PCR test can be presented. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	Employees must wear an FFP2 mask in closed rooms.    The following applies to operators:  â¢	The operator of retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled may only let residents in for new admission if they can present a 2.5G certificate.  â¢	The operator of retirement and nursing homes must offer the residents an antigen test for SARS-CoV-2 or a molecular-biological test for SARS-CoV-2 at least every three days if they have left the home within this period.  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled  Entering old people's and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled is only permitted under certain conditions:  â¢	Visitors: indoor limit: a maximum of two visits per resident and day are permitted,  o	an additional maximum of two people per day to accompany underage residents of inpatient residential facilities for the disabled  o	In addition, a maximum of two people per resident in need of support per day if they perform regular support and care tasks. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  o	Exceptions: visits as part of palliative and hospice support, pastoral care and support in critical life events, external service providers, legally defined representatives, bodies of care supervision or members of established commissions.   â¢	When entering retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled, residents in generally accessible places that do not belong to the living area as well as visitors and accompanying persons must wear a mask.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.  â¢	The planned measures must not be disproportionate or lead to unreasonable hardship.  The following applies to visitors:  â¢	The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they can show proof of 2G and also have a negative PCR test, which was accepted no more than 72 hours ago. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they wear an FFP2 mask at all times during the visit or stay.  The following applies to employees:   â¢	The operator is only allowed to let employees in if they show proof of 2G. If such a test cannot be presented, a valid PCR test must be presented. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	Employees must wear an FFP2 mask in closed rooms.  The following applies to operators:  â¢	The operator of retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled may only let residents in for new admission if they can present a 2.5G certificate.  â¢	The operator of old people's and nursing homes must offer the residents an antigen test for SARS-CoV-2 or a molecular biological test for SARS-CoV-2 at least every three days if they have left the home within this period.  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept. The following applies to employees:   â¢	The operator is only allowed to let employees in if they show proof of 2G. If such a test cannot be presented, a valid PCR test must be presented. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	Employees must wear an FFP2 mask in closed rooms.  The following applies to operators:  â¢	The operator of retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled may only let residents in for new admission if they can present a 2.5G certificate.  â¢	The operator of retirement and nursing homes must offer the residents an antigen test for SARS-CoV-2 or a molecular-biological test for SARS-CoV-2 at least every three days if they have left the home within this period.  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20211217202434/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/
